snippet.textDisplay:
The rational debate against the current narrative of climate change actually has nothing to do with denying it is happening. This is how I understand it.

1. We have plenty of scientific data to show the climate is warming, everyone agrees on that. The problem is there is no data or consensus showing what actual impact that has and the estimates range wildy from minor impact, to the end of the world.

2. The ways we are told to help combat climate change are hugely wasteful and incredibly ineffective compared to other strategies and actually potentially do more harm than just spending way less money to adapt to climate change instead. One example I've heard (haven't done enough research to confirm) is that one of the best ways to reduce carbon is to help third world countries advance as fast as possible but In order to do that they actually need to rely more on fossil fuels short term to get to that point faster, you're not going to give a shit about your impact on climate change if your family is starving for example.

3. Whenever people try to actually argue these points in an earnest attempt to solve the problem they are labeled a "climate denier" so none of thier points need to be taken seriously or even listened to because they are clearly irrational.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Juckya --- Bro. There was literally a first time red warning in the UK cuz it had one of the biggest heat waves its ever had and we keep having them

Wayne Patterson --- The UK Government is infested with Climate Change Alarmists who are determined to indoctrinate an ignorant populace with fearmongering pseudoscience. You can expect more such government initiated efforts to dramatize and exploit extreme weather events. Know, however, that the heat waves are far from being unprecedented in Britain, and you should expect many more events for awhile, until the Sun returns to more active Sunspot Cycles. For about the last 75 years the Sun has been going through a grand maximum Sunspot Cycle, the Modern Maximum. This Modern Maximum followed the Dalton Minimum and the extreme Maunder Minimum "Little Ice Age". The Sunspot Cycle is currently heading into another major Solar Minimum or Grand Solar Minimum which can be expected to turn Britain into an icebox again. Personally, I would not recommend that anyone should be investing into any more cold sensitive British vineyards and wineries for the next 30 years or longer. The cause of Britain's heat waves are the Solar Sunspot cycles.

Whenever the Sun's Sunspot cycle is average to a maximum, the Solar energy strengthens the circumpolar jetstreams. The strong jetstreams more tightly confine the cold Arctic/Antarctic air masses within their respective polar regions and the hot tropical air masses towards their temperate and tropical regions at the lower latitudes. Whenever the Sun's Sunspot cycle is average to a minimum, the lesser Solar energy weakens the circumpolar jetstreams. The weakened jetstreams fail to confine the cold Arctic/Antarctic air masses within their respective polar regions and the hot tropical air masses towards their temperate and tropical regions at the lower latitudes. Instead, the jetstreams slow and begin meandering far more in large bends whose peaks and troughs dip deeply into the polar regions and deeply into the tropical regions of the lower latitudes. The jetstreams than drag Polar cold air masses along the deep bends down into the lower latitudes to produce record cold waves and blizzards and drag hot air masses from the equatorial tropical regions into the temperate and polar high latitudes to produce record high temperatures, drought, and other extreme weather events. During the weak Solar Sunspot minima, the meandering of the weakened circumpolar jetstreams frequently set new record high temperatures and droughts at a given location and record low temperatures and deadly blizzards at the same place in the same year.

During the last 4,500 years there have been more than 70 natural climate change cycles, and the current weather and climate is just another of those natural climate change cycles caused by the Solar variability and celestial mechanics. During those warm climate changes in Britain equally high air temperatures were experienced. For example, Britain experienced one of those extreme heat waves in 1911. So long as the Sunspot cycles over the next cycle of about 11 years =/- n years, do not be surprised to experience alternating periods of extreme cold and hot air masses being dragged across the british Isles by the weakened circumpolar jetstreams. Also note that thermometers and historical temperature records have not been around long enough to observe the normal range of temperature extremes at any given location within or without the British Isles. Consequently, it is commonplace to set new extreme air temperature records in any given region.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Anthony Morris Okay, I take back what I said: You're just another moron spouting nonsense. I'm not going to bother with most of this because I don't particularly enjoy banging my head against brick walls, but there is one point here that really needs to be addressed because it comes up fairly regularly and you should know better:

humanity and fossil fuels created the modern world. So? Fossil fuels played a very significant role in our history. That's not a reason to continue using them forever (which we couldn't even if we wanted). Horses played a significant role in the development of civilization up until the industrial revolution, BUT WE DON'T KEEP RUNNING EVERYTHING ON HORSEPOWER. As technology advances we adopt new, better sources of energy. That's just how technology progresses.

Because here's the thing: regardless of whether you accept that the burning of fossil fuels is changing the climate in ways which will become catastrophic for us or you want to continue being wrong, WE WILL NEED TO TRANSITION OFF FOSSIL FUELS EVENTUALLY BECAUSE WE ARE GOING TO RUN OUT OF THEM. There isn't an infinite amount of oil in the ground. Even if you don't think fossil fuels have any impact on the climate (which would, again, make you objectively wrong) you must acknowledge that we need to transition to renewable energy sources before we actually start running out of fossil fuels. Starting that transition now will only make it less painful than trying to shift everything at the last minute when we're on our last barrels of oil. We could, if we wanted to, meet all of our energy needs with a combination of wind, solar, geothermal, and nuclear power. We don't need fossil fuels anymore.

@Crowe3717 "You seem to be arguing against people who think that carbon dioxide is toxic in the atmosphere," Nope. I was arguing against a post that claimed - "Also, we'll never be at a stage where there is too little CO2. We are wayyyyyy passed that." I stand by my argument. You are arguing something different entirely. Nowhere were either of us discussing warming.

I will now address your arguments. "That's not our concern. Our concern is how the changing climate threatens our civilization." There is no evidence whatsoever that warming is going to "threaten our civilization". This is hyperbolic nonsense. After 200 years of rapidly growing fossil fuel use, 200 years of warming and 43 years of abject climate hysteria, data proves that humanity has never been safer, healthier, or more prosperous than at any time in history, *by any measurement you care to examine*. This trend has never been interrupted. Warming has proven to be mostly benign, easily managed and a net benefit for humanity. You are embracing wild hyperbolic speculations of future events that never materialize, while I examine evidence from events that have already taken place.

"You know what those large herbivores didn't have that we do?" More accurately they didn't have an ounce of technology. Unlike these herbivores, humanity and fossil fuels created the modern world. It's the modern world that keeps you safe. All one has to do is examine the people who live in abject poverty to understand this. Or simply examine how people lived historically. It wasn't pretty I can assure you.

"Populations dependent on stable farming regions in order to sustain themselves. Cities in regions where drinkable water is already scarce." And exactly how are we able to achieve these very things you are citing? Inexpensive reliable energy. How will you feed the world without fossil fuel energy? Where do you think drinkable water comes from? Millions of people in the world have no access to clean water. Guess what is synonymous with this? No access to inexpensive reliable energy.

"You say there's no warming" Where and when did I ever say this?

"If plants were absorbing the increased carbon dioxide into their biomass at the same rate we expel it we wouldn't have a problem," Plant growth catches up to the fertilization of the planet. The Earth is greening. With more Co2 plants grow larger, faster and more resilient absorbing greater amounts of Co2. Your fear mongering no longer stands up to scrutiny.

@Anthony Morris Thank you for providing almost a textbook example of a little knowledge being a dangerous thing. While nothing you've said is technically untrue, it has led you to wildly incorrect conclusions. Let's examine this:

Carbon dioxide's effects on plant growth and its effects on global temperature are two entirely separate things. You seem to be arguing against people who think that carbon dioxide is toxic in the atmosphere, like it's the presence of the carbon dioxide itself which is the problem. But nobody thinks that. Yes, life could flourish if the planet were both hotter and had a higher concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere than it does today. That's not our concern. Our concern is how the changing climate threatens our civilization. You know what those large herbivores didn't have that we do? Immovable infrastructure. Populations dependent on stable farming regions in order to sustain themselves. Cities in regions where drinkable water is already scarce.

The problem isn't that a changing climate is going to directly kill everyone, it's that our civilization is not responsiveconcentrations

Horticulturalists can pump greenhouses full of carbon dioxide all they want, because THAT CARBON DIOXIDE REMAINS CONTAINED AND DOES NOT ALTER THE CLIMATE OF THE ENTIRE PLANET. You say there's no warming but, my guy, have you ever actually been inside a greenhouse? They are absolutely warmer inside than the air outside. There's a reason we call the warming of air by preventing infrared radiation from escaping into space the GREENHOUSE effect. That's literally one of the main reasons people build greenhouses (granted, most of the warming within greenhouses comes from the fact that glass is opaque to infrared, so additional carbon dioxide inside isn't going to have much of an effect because they are ALREADY trapping most of the infrared which would escape).

If plants were absorbing the increased carbon dioxide into their biomass at the same rate we expel it we wouldn't have a problem, but we know that's not happening because the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere is measurably increasing. So we don't actually give a crap how the plants feel about it because the effect that increased concentration of CO2 has on the climate is a much bigger and more immediate concern than whether the plants will still be able to grow after our modern nations collapse.

snippet.textDisplay:
the Northern hemisphere is 33% greener than it was in 1900. Sea levels are rising at the same rate as they were in 1865. The hottest decade on record sine the ending of the "Little Ice Age", was the 1930s into the early 1940s. The earth cooled from from 1940 to 1979 by .3° C.

There was no warming between 1998 and 2015, the Earth has not warmed since 2016. From February 2016 to February 2018, global average temperatures dropped by 0.56° C. The Earth was warmer, there was less sea ice, and the sea levels higher during the "Medieval Warm Period". 2022 Summer Arctic sea extent was greater and the ice thicker, than it was in 2008. Antarctica has been gaining 112 billion tons of ice a year since 1992. Yet according to NASA 2022 was the sixth hottest year on record.

There is no mass extinction event occurring due to climate change, the Polar Bear population is five times what it was in 1960, and at its highest ever recorded. In 2019 more child died from problems associated with obesity, than from malnutrition or starvation.

In 2020 the United States produced 25% more food than it needed or could export. All major crop yields have increased three fold since the 1940s, due in no small part to increased CO2 in the atmosphere. CO2 is a greenhouse gas, however it has never been proven that concentrations of CO2 will cause warming, in fact we know from ice cores that CO2 concentration lags behind periods of rapid warming.

The world population has exploded, however it was expected to top out at nine billion, and then begin decreasing. The reason being that as developing nations become more prosperous, they tend to have less children. By depriving developing nations access to cheap fuel, they are forced to burn wood and dung to cook, light and heat their homes, causing massive health problems, deforestation, and leading to a mass extinction event as they kill local wild life to sustain themselves with protein. Bottom line..... there is no "Climate Crisis"

snippet.textDisplay:
​@Other Justin --- You're making a false equivalence here.

Wayne Patterson --- (LOL) Your comment literally asserts that the imaginary temperature numbers used in the hypothetical temperature datasets and presented in the charts of this video as "Global Average Temperatures" have an equivalence to the actual and observed empirical temperatures in reality. Do you really expect that oxymoron to pass muster?

Other Justin --- You imagine that because climate data has not been taken for every single point on earth at every time in history that a data set is worthless,

Wayne Patterson --- That is a false and Strawman Argument, because that has never been my position on the subject nor my comments. As a meteorologist we routinely used interpolations to perform or forecasting duties. However, that is also why our hypothetical interpolations limited our ability to produce accurate forecasts beyond a small number of days. You simply cannot honestly pretend to have empirical knowledge of the true temperatures of any specific location or aggregate of locations to an accuracy of a tenth of a degree or a single whole degree by inventing hypothetical temperature substitutes for actual temperature observations plus non-existent weather observations. Doing so and misrepresenting them as actual true temperatures is false and fraudulent. The existing data sources are inadequate, and it is impossible to achieve the accuracy falsely asserted in the Alarmist Climate Change propaganda. It is in fact delusional behavior to pretend having knowledge of the historical temperatures with such impossible assertions of accuracy. The methods used to fabricate the imaginary temperatures incorporate accumulated inaccuracies that are magnitudes greater in scope than the temperature increase/s asserted by the Climate Change Alarmists.

Other Justin --- despite the fact global temperature change is taken by aggregate data points from a variety of places around the globe at a given time. This is of course the best humanly possible method of measuring how climate was in the past and comparing it to another time

Wayne Patterson --- Anyone and everyone are welcome to postulate conjectures and hypotheses regarding speculations about the possible ranges of temperature conditions in each of the time periods, but the Alarmist Climate Change misrepresentation of the imaginary numbers in the hypothetical temperature datasets is simply unscientific and dishonest exercises in false propaganda. In the absence of accurate empirical observations of the temperatures with the valid spatial distribution requirements for statistical adequacy leaves no other honest choice except to recognize the true temperatures for missing stations and altered records are unknown and unknowable. Consequently, the imaginary "Global Average Temperatures" published by the Climate Change Alarmists exemplify the practice of a pseudoscience, because the absence of accurate and empirical temperature observations denies the scientific community the required opportunity to verify or disprove the accuracy of the Alarmist temperature datasets by observation or experiment. Any Alarmist hypothesis which cannot be subject to verification or denial by comparison to empirical observations and experiments are by definition the practice of a pseudoscience. It make no difference whatsoever if and when the non-compliant and imaginary Alarmist datasets are or are not the "the best humanly possible method of measuring how climate was in the past." Imaginary temperature data is still imaginary, conjectural, hypothetical and not empirical representations of reality. They are instead arbitrary fictions and fantasies falsely masquerading as reality.

snippet.textDisplay:
To be fair even prior to Moor leaving, Greenpeace sold their soul down the river a while ago to support Natural Gas over Nuclear despite sufficient evidence that Nuclear was going to have more impact on emissions reduction.

Greenpeace stopped following the science years ago and is basically a broken clock at this point: Yes, they are right about Global Warming and Climate Change, but at this point they have embraced solutions that have not helped nor addressed anything because they'd rather talk about de-industrialization and a return to pre-1800s society over....addressing the actual needs.

Good example is Germany, who has basically been Greenpeace's poster child, spent $500 billion on a Renewables plan while phasing out Nuclear....and then couldn't cut their emissions to even half of what France is doing next door but act like they have the solution.

During the Ukraine War, Greenpeace has been cheering using Natural Gas and even Coal in Germany rather than stopping the shutdown of Germanys last nuclear plants. Because these are somehow green.
